## Beck Anxiety Inventory vs MFQ

Comparing the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) and Mood and Feelings Questionnaire (MFQ) can be quite challenging for researchers. Both tools are valuable for assessing anxiety and mood in individuals, but they each focus on different aspects and symptoms. The BAI is concentrated more on the somatic symptoms while MFQ looks at the cognitive and emotional aspects of mood. This makes the process of comparison and harmonisation of the two instruments crucial but laborious.

## Compare the items in Beck Anxiety Inventory and MFQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import Beck Anxiety Inventory and MFQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just Beck Anxiety Inventory into Harmony</a> - compare Beck Anxiety Inventory with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MFQ into Harmony</a> - compare MFQ with other instruments



Harmony uses natural language processing and generative AI models to compare and harmonise questionnaire items. With Beck Anxiety Inventory vs MFQ, Harmony can provide a percentage match for each item, helping researchers to harmonise the two instruments effectively and efficiently. This method and the results are not only time-saving but also reliable, overcoming the issue of subjectivity in manual comparison and harmonisation.
